# Packages & Functions Reference {#packages-functions-reference .unnumbered}

This table consolidates the packages and commands used throughout the book, what each command does, and where it is first introduced.

```{r include=FALSE}
library(tibble)
library(dplyr)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)

ref_trying <- tribble(
  ~Package, ~Command, ~`What it does`, ~`First introduced`,
  "base R", "`<-`", "Assigns values to objects for later use.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`c()`", "Combines multiple values into a single vector.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`:`", "Creates integer sequences (e.g., `1:10`).", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`[]`", "Indexes and subsets elements from vectors or data frames.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`$`", "Accesses or creates columns within a data frame.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`sqrt()`", "Computes square roots.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`log()` / `log10()`", "Computes natural and base-10 logarithms.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`round()`", "Rounds numeric values to a specified number of digits.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`class()`", "Identifies the data type (class) of an object.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
  "base R", "`length()`", "Returns the number of elements in a vector.", "[Introduction to R](#intro-key-functions)",
```
